primaryMeaning: Something Heard For The First Time
meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>first</kanji> time something reaches your <kanji>ear</kanji>, it's <vocabulary>something heard for the first time</vocabulary>. If it's never entered your ear before, it's <vocabulary>news</vocabulary> to you!
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word that uses kun'yomi instead of on'yomi readings, because 初 behaves more like a prefix here. You already know how to read 耳, but you haven't learned the kun'yomi for 初 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you remember it:

Whatever it is, this <vocabulary>something heard for the first time</vocabulary>, be sure to hold onto your <reading>hats</reading> (はつ)! It's going to be something big, and I'm pretty sure it's going to be <vocabulary>news</vocabulary> to me, too.
